info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 3, game 1.

(1, 1).clue: To fulfill a prophecy, in the Gospels Joseph moved to this place--not the one of the same name in Kentucky

(3, 1).clue: This bird is called a "bow & arrow" (perhaps because of the way it killed Cock Robin)

(4, 1).clue: On the 1830s "Survivor: Texas", Susanna Dickinson & her child won the immunity challenge at this epic battle

(5, 1).clue: The 89% high school graduation rate of this "Garden State" is the USA's highest

(6, 1).clue: This symbol adorns the flag of Finland as well as the flag of its neighbor Sweden

(1, 2).clue: In Psalms "We wept, when we remembered" this, also preceding a "Crossroads" near Charlottesville, Virginia

(2, 2).clue: 1968:Babs rises from the slums to become a star in the Ziegfeld Follies

(3, 2).clue: Use your band of hope--soap--to wash these, your "German bands"

(4, 2).clue: In 1944's version of "The Apprentice", Von Stauffenberg was fired by a squad after he tried to fire this leader

(5, 2).clue: His famed "Blue-backed Speller" of 1783 helped standardize American spelling & pronunciation

(6, 2).clue: From 1809 until 1917, Finland was an autonomous Grand Duchy of this country

(1, 3).clue: These bubbled near the biblical Bethel & Siloam, & follow "Bethel" & "Siloam" in Southern U.S. place names

(2, 3).clue: 1983:Barbra disguises herself as a boy to get an education

(3, 3).clue: If I ask for some "you & me", I'm not hitting on you, I merely want this, especially in the afternoon

(4, 3).clue: On the 1880s "The Osbournes", this author amused stepson Lloyd Osbourne with tales of a boy on the high seas

(5, 3).clue: It's the "watery" term for integrating a student with special needs into a regular class

(6, 3).clue: Of Flensheim, Mannerheim or Suomiheim, the man who was Finland's greatest military leader during WWII

(1, 4).clue: Jesus visited Mary & Martha in this place--not the one of the same name in northern Missouri

(2, 4).clue: 1991:Barbra counsels a troubled man with a mysterious family secret

(3, 4).clue: "Sky rockets" are these; hope you've got some "bees & honey" in yours

(4, 4).clue: On "American Idol", Creek & Cherokee Indians performed the Busk ceremony when this crop was ready for roasting

(5, 4).clue: This N.C. univ. built by tobacco magnates once had separate colleges: Trinity College & Woman's College

(6, 4).clue: Finland hosted the Summer Olympics in this year

(1, 5).clue: It's Jerusalem to Isaiah, a peaceful "land" to John Bunyan, & a small "ville" in North Carolina

(2, 5).clue: 1979:Babs is bankrupt & decides to manage a boxer

(3, 5).clue: This part of your body is your "Chevy Chase" (Chevy Chase wouldn't want to fall on his)

(4, 5).clue: Indian Ocean "Big Brother" saw Kasyapa kill dad & build Sigiriya Fort as defense from his sibling on this island

(5, 5).clue: In 1907 she opened her first Casa dei Bambini, or "Children's Home"

(6, 5).clue: Due to its low salinity, this gulf between Sweden & Finland may have an ice cover for up to 5 months of the year

(1, 1).clue: This area was a toxic dump for over a decade before it was developed for homes & a school

(3, 1).clue: Sand is composed largely of oxygen & this element, atomic number 14

(4, 1).clue: This almost 70-year-old tenor dedicated his first pop CD, "Ti adoro", to his baby daughter Alice

(5, 1).clue: 1940's "The Visage of War", a surreal work from this artist, is seen here

(6, 1).clue: Usually found at convenience stores, this men's mag was launched in the U.S. by Dennis Publishing in 1997

(1, 2).clue: A jury verdict handed down in this California valley city sparked the devastation seen here in Los Angeles more than 30 miles away

(3, 2).clue: The pH in pH scale stands for "potential of" this element

(4, 2).clue: This Grammy-winning singer is Ravi Shankar's daughter

(5, 2).clue: The influence of Rembrandt can be seen in Carel Fabritius' painting "The Raising of" this biblical man

(6, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from San Diego, CA with the U.S.S. Tarawa in the background.)  As an amphibious assault ship, the Tarawa's main mission is to land up to 2,000 of these service members on shore & to sustain them there

(1, 3).clue: (Hi, I'm Nancy Grace with CNN Headline News.)  As a former Fulton County prosecutor, I went to the scene in this city to cover the deadly shootings in the same courtroom where I prosecuted felony cases

(3, 3).clue: It's important in bone-building, & the red type of it will light your fire on a matchstick

(4, 3).clue: This bestselling mystery writer's father, C.W., used consecutive lines of a nursery rhyme for his titles

(5, 3).clue: When you think of Renaissance art, the Italian name of this masterpiece should spring to mind

(6, 3).clue: This national park whose name is Spanish for "green table" contains many well-preserved Indian cliff dwellings

(1, 4).clue: The Bay Area was hit by the quake whose aftermath is seen here, named for this mountain near the epicenter

(3, 4).clue: Sometimes this metallic element, No. 72, "is better than the whole"

(4, 4).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from the Barnes Foundation.)  This famous son was not quite 2 years old when Dad put him at the center of "The Artist’s Family"

(5, 4).clue: This "Liberty Leading the People" artist also painted "The Battle of Poitiers"

(6, 4).clue: Although it's controversial, the U.N. designates one member nation "The former Yugoslav Republic of" this

(1, 5).clue: The lieutenant colonel seen here is about to testify about his time on this government body from 1981 to 1986

(3, 5).clue: Rf is the symbol for this element named for a physicist

(4, 5).clue: British poet & painter Frieda Hughes is the daughter of this other British poet

(5, 5).clue: This Flemish artist created a 15th-century portrait that’s spoofed in the opening of TV’s “Desperate Housewives”

(6, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from the Charleston, SC waterfront.)  In 1776, his defense of Fort Sullivan in Charleston Harbor got the fort renamed for him

(0, 0).clue: This Mediterranean island shares its name with President Garfield's nickname for his wife
